snippet: For Dr. James D. Watson, a co-winner of the prize for the discovery of the structure of DNA, the sale became part of an effort to redeem himself for making offensive remarks about black people.
abstract: James D Watson's 1962 Nobel Prize medal sells for $4.1 million at Christie's auction in Manhattan; Watson shared award for discovery of the double-helix structure of DNA, and has pledged to donate much of the proceeds to educational institutions that had nurtured him.
lead_paragraph: For Dr. James D. Watson, a co-winner of the prize for the discovery of the structure of DNA, the sale became part of an effort to redeem himself for making offensive remarks about black people.

headline.main: Watson’s Nobel Prize Medal for Decoding DNA Fetches $4.1 Million at an Auction
headline.print_headline: Watson’s Nobel Prize Medal for Decoding DNA Fetches $4.1 Million at an Auction
